page.title: 09RELIGION IN BOOTHBY PAGNELL
page.content: St.Andrews church Boothby is Church of England.It is the only religious place in Boothby.Built in 12th century the nave is the oldest part of the church.The tower,also 12th century,has a Norman doorway.There are 3 bells,all unsafe to be rung.The top of the tower has 8 pinacled battlements.The Norman Font has an Oak top of 1896.South and North aisles and Chancel were all rebuilt in 14th cetury.The north aisle was a chapel.The only ancient glass in the church is in the South Porch windows,and was built in the 14th century.In 1896 the church was restored.The churchyard was extended,the Lychgate and Vestry were built.A Lady Chapel was formed in the south aisle.There is a service or evensong every Sunday.
